solution_line_template: Half of the floors have different numbers of apartments. Half the number of floors is {total_floors} floors / {half_divisor} = <<{total_floors}/{half_divisor}={half_floors}>>{half_floors} floors.

One half of the block consists of {half_floors} floors * {apartments_per_floor_half1} apartments/floor = <<{half_floors}*{apartments_per_floor_half1}={apartments_half1}>>{apartments_half1} apartments.
And the other half consists of {half_floors} floors * {apartments_per_floor_half2} apartments/floor = <<{half_floors}*{apartments_per_floor_half2}={apartments_half2}>>{apartments_half2} apartments.
There are {apartments_half2} + {apartments_half1} = <<{apartments_half2}+{apartments_half1}={total_apartments}>>{total_apartments} apartments on all floors in the block.

All the apartments can therefore accommodate {total_apartments} apartments * {max_residents_per_apartment} residents/apartment = <<{total_apartments}*{max_residents_per_apartment}={max_residents}>>{max_residents} residents.
